abstract.text: Creates a test postback for an in-app ad.

inlineContent.text: To test postbacks for SKAdNetwork version 4.0 or later, use
instead.

Your ad network identifier. For the test environment, you may use any lowercased value. You must use the same value to verify the signature after you receive the postback on your server. Also, use the same ad network identifier in the
of the source app in the testing environment.
The campaign identifier associated with the ad.
The App Store item identifier of the advertised app.
The App Store item identifier of the app that displays the ad. This value is
in the testing environment.
SKAdNetwork version 2.0 and later. An unsigned 6-bit value that the installed app provides by calling
. Note: In the production environment, the conversion-value only appears in the postback if the installed app provides it, and if providing the parameter meets Apple’s privacy threshold.
SKAdNetwork version 2.2 and later. A value of
indicates a view-through ad presentation; a value of
indicates a StoreKit-rendered ad.
SKAdNetwork version 2.0 and later. A Boolean flag that in the production environment indicates that the customer redownloaded and reinstalled the app when the value is
SKAdNetwork version 3.0 and later. A Boolean value that’s
if the ad network won the attribution, and
if the postback represents a qualifying ad impression that didn’t win the attribution.
A URL on your server where you can receive test postbacks.
Create one to six test postbacks to use for unit testing. Call
to add the test postbacks to the test session.

abstract.text: Updates the conversion value and verifies the first launch of an app installed as a result of an ad.
Learn about the features in each SKAdNetwork version.
Create and automate tests in Xcode for your app’s subscription and in-app purchase transactions, and SKAdNetwork implementations.
A test postback that contains ad conversion information in the testing environment.
Creates a test postback for an in-app ad.
Creates a test postback for a web ad or an in-app ad.
Creates a sequence of test postbacks for an in-app or web ad impression.
A constant that indicates the postback version.
Add test postbacks to the test session.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
